com.apperian.javautil

Class Accessor

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.apperian.javautil.Accessor

  • public final class Accessor
extends java.lang.Object
    Provides an interface for invoking the protected and private methods of an object.
    Version:
    0.1
    Author:
    James Seibel, Kevin LaFlamme

    • Method Detail

      • invokeMethod

        public static java.lang.Object invokeMethod(java.lang.Object obj,
                            java.lang.String methodName,
                            java.lang.Object[] args,
                            java.lang.Class<?>... parameterTypes)
                                     throws java.lang.NoSuchMethodException,
                                            java.lang.SecurityException,
                                            UnsupportedTypeException
        Calls method methodName on obj

        For instance methods, this will look up the class of obj and then search for a method matching the passed in methodName and parameterTypes. If obj is an instance of Class, then this will assume the method is static and will search for the method on obj directly.

        Parameters:
        obj - The object to invoke the method on, this should be a Class object for static methods
        methodName - The name of the method to invoke
        args - An array of arguments to pass to the method
        parameterTypes - An array of classes that represent the argument types
        Returns:
        Returns the return value of the invoked method
        Throws:
        java.lang.NoSuchMethodException
        java.lang.SecurityException
        UnsupportedTypeException

      • invokeMethod

        public static java.lang.Object invokeMethod(java.lang.Object obj,
                            java.lang.String methodName,
                            java.lang.Object[] args)
                                     throws java.lang.NoSuchMethodException,
                                            UnsupportedTypeException
        Calls method methodName on obj

        For instance methods, this will look up the class of obj and then loop through the methods of the class and select the first method matching methodName. This is a convenience function but is not performant and may return the wrong method if there is more than one defined with the same name (different signatures). If obj is an instance of Class, then this will assume the method is static and will search for the method on obj directly.

        Parameters:
        obj - The object to invoke the method on
        methodName - The name of the method to invoke
        args - An array of arguments to pass to the method
        Returns:
        Returns the return value of the invoked method
        Throws:
        java.lang.NoSuchMethodException
        UnsupportedTypeException

      • invokeMethod

        public static java.lang.Object invokeMethod(java.lang.Object obj,
                            java.lang.reflect.Method method,
                            java.lang.Object[] args)
                                     throws UnsupportedTypeException
        Calls method on obj

        This will invoke method using obj as this, passing args as the arguments. obj should be a {Class if method is static

        Parameters:
        obj - The object to invoke the method on
        method - The Method object to invoke
        args - An array of arguments to pass to the method
        Returns:
        Returns the return value of the invoked method
        Throws:
        UnsupportedTypeException

      • getField

        public static java.lang.Object getField(java.lang.Object obj,
                        java.lang.String fieldName)
                                 throws UnsupportedTypeException,
                                        java.lang.NoSuchFieldException
        Gets fieldName from obj

        For instance fields, this will look up the class of obj and then lookup the field of the class with the given fieldName. If obj is an instance of Class, then this will assume the field is static and will search for the field on obj directly.

        Parameters:
        obj - The object to retrieve the field from
        fieldName - The name of the field to retrieve
        Returns:
        Returns the return value of the field on obj
        Throws:
        UnsupportedTypeException
        java.lang.NoSuchFieldException

      • getField

        public static java.lang.Object getField(java.lang.Object obj,
                        java.lang.reflect.Field field)
                                 throws UnsupportedTypeException
        Gets field field on obj

        This will retrieve field using obj as this. obj should be a {Class if field is static

        Parameters:
        obj - The object to retrieve the field from
        field - The Field object to retrieve
        Returns:
        Returns the return value of the field on obj
        Throws:
        UnsupportedTypeException

      • setField

        public static void setField(java.lang.Object obj,
            java.lang.String fieldName,
            java.lang.Object value)
                     throws UnsupportedTypeException,
                            java.lang.NoSuchFieldException,
                            java.lang.ClassCastException
        Sets fieldName on obj to value

        For instance fields, this will look up the class of obj and then lookup the field of the class with the given fieldName. If obj is an instance of Class, then this will assume the field is static and will search for the field on obj directly.

        Parameters:
        obj - The object to retrieve the field from
        fieldName - The name of the field to retrieve
        value - The value to set
        Throws:
        UnsupportedTypeException
        java.lang.NoSuchFieldException
        java.lang.ClassCastException

      • setField

        public static void setField(java.lang.Object obj,
            java.lang.reflect.Field field,
            java.lang.Object value)
                     throws UnsupportedTypeException,
                            java.lang.ClassCastException
        Sets field field on obj to value

        This will set field to value using obj as this. obj should be a {Class if field is static

        Parameters:
        obj - The object to retrieve the field from
        field - The Field object to set
        value - The value to set
        Throws:
        UnsupportedTypeException
        java.lang.ClassCastException
